thread.title: Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2
thread.title_full: Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2

title: Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2 Star third baseman Adrian Beltre is not in the Rangers’ starting lineup for Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto. Post to Facebook Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2 Star third baseman Adrian Beltre is not in the Rangers’ starting lineup for Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto. Check out this story on WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1LlKs24 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Adrian Beltre not in Rangers lineup for ALDS Game 2 Landon Haaf, WFAA Sports 10:01 a.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Adrian Beltre is helped off the field in the third inning after an injury sustained against the Toronto Blue Jays in game one of the ALDS at Rogers Centre. (Photo: Nick Turchiaro-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Star third baseman Adrian Beltre is not in the Rangers’ starting lineup for Game 2 of the American League Division Series in Toronto. 
Beltre left Game 1 with stiffness in his lower back. The Associated Press reported that Beltre was given an anti-inflammatory shot during the win, but he wasn’t slated to start Game 2, which is scheduled for an 11:45 a.m. CT first pitch. 
Rookie Hanser Alberto, who took over for Beltre Thursday, will start at third base Friday. ALCS Game 2 at TOR: DeShields 8, Choo 9, Fielder DH, Moreland 3,Andrus 6,Hamilton 7, Odor 4, Gimenez 2, Alberto 5, Hamels 1 — John Blake (@RangerBlake) October 9, 2015 
Beltre, who hit .328 with 10 home runs and 56 RBIs after Aug. 1, hit an RBI single Thursday. He limped to first base and was taken out after sliding into second base moments later. Adrian Beltre, Josh Donaldson leave Game 1 of ALDS with injuries 
Alberto batted .222 in 104 regular season plate appearances with Texas this year. He went hitless in two at-bats Thursday. 
Blue Jays third baseman and MVP candidate Josh Donaldson left Thursday's game with a head injury, but was listed in the Jays' starting lineup Friday morning. Jose Bautista, who also had an injury scare Thursday, was also slated to start. After suffering injury scares in Game 1, @BlueJays sluggers Josh Donaldson, Jose Bautista in lineup for Game 2, batting 2nd and 3rd.
